meanings.definition: Fail to attain an intended goal or purpose.
meanings.sent1: She kept miscarrying her attempts to bake a perfect cake.
meanings.sent2: The team was miscarrying their chances of winning the game.
meanings.sent3: Despite her best efforts, she was constantly miscarrying her plans to organize her room.
meanings.sent4: His unreliable car kept miscarrying his plans for a smooth road trip.
meanings.sent5: The student felt frustrated after miscarrying his goal of getting an A on the test.

meanings.definition: Experience a miscarriage, especially in relation to pregnancy.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the risks of miscarrying during the early stages of pregnancy.
meanings.sent2: She was devastated after miscarrying her first pregnancy.
meanings.sent3: The couple was heartbroken after miscarrying their hopes for a new addition to the family.
meanings.sent4: The fragile pregnancy was like a delicate flower, easily miscarrying under stress.
meanings.sent5: The young mother was terrified of miscarrying and took extra precautions during her second pregnancy.
